data.enText: the quality of sb's voice, especially expressing a particular emotion

data.chText: 以压低、低沉、短促、缓慢谨慎等的语调讲话
别用那种口吻跟我讲话。
data.enText: Don't speak to me in that tone of voice (= in that unpleasant way) .

data.chText: 不必那样跟我拿腔拿调的。我们来晚了，可不是我的错。
data.enText: There's no need to take that tone with me─it's not my fault we're late.
the general character and attitude of sth such as a piece of writing, or the atmosphere of an event

data.chText: 这本书整体格调是温情的怀旧。
data.enText: The overall tone of the book is gently nostalgic.

data.chText: 她坚定地说明了公司的方针，为会议定下了调子。
data.enText: She set the tone for the meeting with a firm statement of company policy.

data.chText: 管保你会降低谈话的格调（如讲粗俗的笑话）。
data.enText: Trust you to lower the tone of the conversation (= for example by telling a rude joke) .

data.chText: 这篇文章的基调是温和的，对争论双方的意见都予以表达。
data.enText: The article was moderate in tone and presented both sides of the case.

data.chText: （尤指乐器或电子音响设备的）音质，音色
data.enText: the quality of a sound, especially the sound of a musical instrument or one produced by electronic equipment
the full rich tone of the trumpet

data.chText: 汽车立体声系统音量和音质的控制装置
data.enText: the volume and tone controls on a car stereo

data.chText: 棕色和橘黄色的暖色调地毯
data.enText: a carpet in warm tones of brown and orange
how strong and firm your muscles or skin are

data.chText: 如何使肌肉发达 / 皮肤柔韧
data.enText: how to improve your muscle/skin tone
a sound heard on a telephone line
Please speak after the tone (= for example as an instruction on an answering machine) .
one of the five longer intervals in a musical scale , for example the interval between C and D or between E and F♯
the pitch (= how high or low a sound is) of a syllable in speaking
a particular pitch pattern on a syllable in languages such as Chinese, that can be used to distinguish different meanings

data.chText: 有…音调的（或音质的、色调的）
data.enText: having the type of tone mentioned

data.chText: 使更健壮；使更结实；使更有力
data.enText: to make your muscles, skin, etc. firmer and stronger

data.chText: 按摩有助于使颏下松弛的皮肤柔韧起来。
data.enText: Massage will help to tone up loose skin under the chin.
to match the colour of sth

data.chText: 他那夹克的米黄色与乳白色的衬衫非常协调。
data.enText: The beige of his jacket toned (in) with the cream shirt.

data.chText: 使（讲话、意见等）缓和；使温和
data.enText: to make a speech, an opinion, etc. less extreme or offensive

data.chText: 这篇文章的措辞必须缓和一下以适合大众市场。
data.enText: The language of the article will have to be toned down for the mass-market.
to make a colour less bright

data.text: colour ♦ shade ♦ tone ♦ hue ♦ tint ♦ tinge

data.chText: 以上各词均涉及颜色、色彩。
data.enText: All these words describe the appearance of things, resulting from the way in which they reflect light.

data.chText: 指颜色、色彩（如红色、绿色、蓝色）：
data.enText: the appearance that things have, resulting from the way in which they reflect light. Red, green and blue are colours.

data.chText: 你最喜欢的颜色是什么？
鲜艳的 / 深 / 浅颜色
指色彩的浓淡深浅、色度（如天蓝是蓝色的一种）
data.enText: a particular form of a colour, especially when describing how light or dark it is. Sky blue is a shade of blue.
a particular shade of a colour

data.chText: 棕色和橘黄色的暖色调地毯
data.enText: a carpet in warm tones of brown and orange

data.chText: tone常用作复数，指色质的细小差别，可说：
data.enText: Tone is often used in the plural to refer to small differences in the quality of a colour. You can say
( literary or technical ) a colour or a particular shade of a colour

data.chText: 他的脸上透出一丝病态的苍白。
data.enText: His face took on an unhealthy, whitish hue.

data.chText: colour较通用，更常用于日常表达。
data.enText: Colour is more general and far more frequent in everyday language.

data.chText: 指色调、淡色彩、一层淡色：
data.enText: a shade or small amount of a particular colour; a faint colour covering a surface

data.chText: 金秋时节略呈红黄色的树叶
data.enText: leaves with red and gold autumn tints
a small amount of a colour

data.chText: 天空略带一点淡淡的粉红色。
data.enText: There was a pink tinge to the sky.

data.chText: 以上两词指淡色彩时用法非常相似，可以说：
data.enText: These two words are very similar when describing a small amount of a colour. You can say

data.chText: tint常用作复数，但tinge几乎总是作单数。
data.enText: Tint is often used in the plural, but tinge is almost always singular.

means: (尤指乐器或电子音响设备的)音质，音色

data.chText: 使（讲话、意见等）缓和；使温和
data.enText: to make a speech, an opinion, etc. less extreme or offensive

data.chText: 这篇文章的措辞必须缓和一下以适合大众市场。
data.enText: The language of the article will have to be toned down for the mass-market.
to make a colour less bright

trans: 使（言辞）温和；使（调子）缓和；收敛
使（颜色）柔和；使（味道）变淡；调和

tr: a quality of a given color that differs slightly from another color
example: after several trials he mixed the shade of pink that she wanted

tr: (linguistics) a pitch or change in pitch of the voice that serves to distinguish words in tonal languages
example: the Beijing dialect uses four tones

tr: (music) the distinctive property of a complex sound (a voice or noise or musical sound)
example: the timbre of her soprano was rich and lovely
the muffled tones of the broken bell summoned them to meet

tr: the quality of something (an act or a piece of writing) that reveals the attitudes and presuppositions of the author
example: the general tone of articles appearing in the newspapers is that the government should withdraw
from the tone of her behavior I gathered that I had outstayed my welcome
they tested his hearing with pure tones of different frequencies

tr: a musical interval of two semitones
a notation representing the pitch and duration of a musical sound
example: the singer held the note too long

tr: the quality of a person's voice
example: he began in a conversational tone
he spoke in a nervous tone of voice

tr: the general atmosphere of a place or situation and the effect that it has on people
example: the feel of the city excited him
a clergyman improved the tone of the meeting
it had the smell of treason

tr: the elastic tension of living muscles, arteries, etc. that facilitate response to stimuli
change the color or tone of
vary the pitch of one's speech
utter monotonously and repetitively and rhythmically
example: The students chanted the same slogan over and over again

value.def: The tone of a sound is its particular quality.

example.ex: Cross could hear him speaking in low tones to Sarah.
example.tran: 克罗斯听得到他对萨拉低声说话。

example.ex: ...the clear tone of the bell.
example.tran: 清亮的铃音

value.def: Someone's tone is a quality in their voice which shows what they are feeling or thinking.

example.ex: I still didn't like his tone of voice...
example.tran: 我还是不喜欢他说话的语气。

example.ex: Suddenly he laughed again, this time with a cold, sharp tone…
example.tran: 突然他又笑了，这次笑得冷漠、刺耳。

example.ex: Her tone implied that her patience was limited.
example.tran: 她的口气暗示她的耐心是有限的。

value.def: The tone of a speech or piece of writing is its style and the opinions or ideas expressed in it.

example.ex: The spokesman said the tone of the letter was very friendly...
example.tran: 发言人说信函的语气非常友好。

example.ex: His comments to reporters were conciliatory in tone...
example.tran: 他对记者们的讲话带着安抚的口吻。

example.ex: The whole tone of President Suharto's speech was one of continuity and stability.
example.tran: 苏哈托总统演讲的整个基调是强调连续性与稳定性。

value.def: The tone of a place or an event is its general atmosphere.

example.ex: The high tone of the occasion was assured by the presence of a dozen wealthy patrons…
example.tran: 十几位富有资助人的出席确保了仪式的高格调。

example.ex: The service desk at the entrance, with its friendly, helpful and efficient staff, sets the tone for the rest of the store.
example.tran: 入口处设有服务台，加之友好、热心与高效的服务人员，营造了这家商店的整体氛围。

value.def: The tone of someone's body, especially their muscles, is its degree of firmness and strength.

example.ex: ...stretch exercises that aim to improve muscle tone...
example.tran: 旨在提高肌肉结实度的伸展锻炼

example.ex: Keeping your muscles strong and in tone helps you to avoid back problems.
example.tran: 保持肌肉强健有力有助于避免背部疾病。

value.tran: （身体的）强健状况；(尤指肌肉的)紧实度，结实度

value.def: Something that tones your body makes it firm and strong.

example.ex: This movement lengthens your spine and tones the spinal nerves...
example.tran: 这一动作舒展脊椎，使脊神经更加强健。

example.ex: Try these toning exercises before you start the day.
example.tran: 在开始一天的活动之前，试着做做这些强身健体的体操。

example.ex: ...finely toned muscular bodies.
example.tran: 健美强壮的身体

example.ex: Exercise tones up your body...
example.tran: 锻炼使身体结实强健。

example.ex: Although it's not strenuous exercise, you feel toned-up, supple and relaxed.
example.tran: 虽然这不是剧烈运动，但会让人感到强健、柔韧与放松。

value.def: A tone is one of the lighter, darker, or brighter shades of the same colour.

example.ex: Each brick also varies slightly in tone, texture and size...
example.tran: 每块砖在色调、质地与大小上也都略有不同。

example.ex: I'm a cheery sort of person, so I like cheerful tones.
example.tran: 我是个活泼类型的人，因此喜欢明亮的色调。

example.ex: …two-tone, striped wallpaper.
example.tran: 两种色调、带条纹的墙纸

value.def: If one thing tones with another, the two things look nice together because their colours are similar in quality or brightness.

example.ex: Princess Margaret toned with her in a turquoise print dress.
example.tran: 玛格丽特公主那条青绿色的印花裙子与她很相配。

example.ex: The bowls tone in cleverly with the mugs.
example.tran: 那些碗与杯子巧妙相配。

value.def: A tone is one of the sounds that you hear when you are using a telephone, for example the sound that tells you that a number is engaged or busy, or no longer exists.
A tone is a difference in pitch between two musical notes equal to two semitones.
If you say that something lowers the tone of a place or event, you mean that it is not appropriate and makes the place or event seem less respectable.

example.ex: Councillors say plastic-framed windows lower the tone of the neighbourhood.
example.tran: 市政会委员说塑料框架的窗户让这个社区掉份儿了。

value.def: If you tone down a colour or a flavour, you make it less bright or strong.

example.ex: When Ken Hom wrote his first book for the BBC he was asked to tone down the spices and garlic in his recipes.
example.tran: 当肯·霍姆为英国广播公司写第一本书的时候，他被要求在菜谱里少用些香料和大蒜。

value.tran: 使(颜色)柔和；使(味道)变淡;调和

trans: 口吻；语调；音调；语气；口气
奠定基调；定调子；定调；定下基调；打赢对战系列首战
色调；染颜色必须选择两只色调；色彩；彩妆小样
音色；声音色彩；声响颜色
純音；纯音；声信号有纯音
使（言辞）温和；使（调子）缓和；收敛；使（颜色）柔和；使（味道）变淡；调和
单音；单频；单频模式；单音模式；一个单音
同 dialling tone；(电话的)拨号音
阳平；上声；升调；声调；阴平
